application.controller

Class PhotonMainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.controller.PhotonMainController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent>

    public class PhotonMainController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent>
    Photon Photo Editor - AKA the next Photoshop! A simple paint program that allows you to import and image for editing, and create your own from scratch. Supports undo/redo operations, custom brush sizes, fonts, etc.
    Since:
    12-3-2020
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Madeline Kotara - duk128
    See Also:
    Stack, Canvas, Node

      private void initializeCanvas()
      Initializes the canvas as well as includes the primary logic for drawing objects and pushing new images on to the undoStack so undo/redo operations can work

      Initializes the font and brush size sliders, loads all system fonts into the FontPicker Combobox

      Initializes all buttons and loads the related image as the graphic for the button

      • scaleImage

        private javafx.scene.image.Image scaleImage(javafx.scene.image.Image sourceImg,
                                            int targetWidth,
                                            int targetHeight,
                                            boolean preserveRatio)
        Scales down an image so it fits properly on the canvas and maintains aspect ratio
        Parameters:
        sourceImg - The source image being loaded from the disk
        targetWidth - The width to be applied to the image, ideally the same as canvas width or smaller
        targetHeight - The height to be applied to the image, ideally the same as canvas height or smaller
        preserveRatio - true if the image ratio should be preserved so it doesn't look stretched
        Returns:
        Image that has been scaled down to the canvas dimensions

      • scaleUpImage

        private javafx.scene.image.WritableImage scaleUpImage(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
                                                      double pixelScale)
        Currently not used/working. The undo/redo operations suffer from quality loss because of how snapshotting a canvas works. Any screen higher than 256 dpi will experience this loss of quality.
        Parameters:
        canvas - the canvas used to draw images to
        pixelScale - the multiplier to upscale images
        Returns:
        WritableImage that has been scaled up without losing quality

      • scaleUpImageTest

        private void scaleUpImageTest(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas,
                              double pixelScale)
        Alternative implementation Currently not used/working. The undo/redo operations suffer from quality loss because of how snapshotting a canvas works. Any screen higher than 256 dpi will experience this loss of quality.
        Parameters:
        canvas - the canvas used to draw images to
        pixelScale - the multiplier to upscale images

      • scaleUpImage2

        private javafx.scene.image.Image scaleUpImage2(javafx.scene.Node node,
                                               int scale)
        Test implementation of scaleUpImage and scaleUpImageTest
        Parameters:
        node - the source node containing the image you want to scale, in this case, the canvas
        scale - the multiplier used to upscale the images
        Returns:
        Image that has been scaled up without losing quality
